page.title: 13St.Matthew's Church Wookey
page.content: St.Matthew's Church is situated in the village of Wookey. The present incumbent, who has held the post for two years, is the Reverend Bindon Plowman. He lives in a new vicarage built in the grounds of the much larger, older vicarage. The medieval church, which today seats 280 people, is about 78 feet long by 37 feet wide and has a square tower which is 63 feet high. The oldest parts of the present church are the chancel wall, east window and the font, which were probably designed by a thirteenth century architect in the pre-decorated style. The rest of the church, except the S.E Chapel, was probably built in the following 150 years. A graveyard surrounds the church but none of the dates on the gravestones are older than the eighteenth century.
